data.description: Selecting an obscure and complex password and changing it frequently can spell the difference between keeping your data secure and having your personal information stolen.
If you have a weak password, it’ll be that much easier for cyber criminals to steal your information, money or identity.
The time it will take to crack a 7 character password made up of mixed numbers and lower and upper case letters is 3 hours.
Longer is always better, but that length yields diminishing returns if you’re not still mixing it up.
The use of strong passwords is therefore essential in order to protect your security and identity.
Because password hacking is one of the most common ways that hackers break into computers, we can no longer rely on traditional passwords.
A strong password is one that is more secure by virtue of being difficult for a machine or a human to guess.

Passwords are the first line of defense against unwanted access to your computer or accounts. The stronger a password, the better protected your computer or accounts will be from hackers or malicious software.
If you have strong password, no hacker break it. Your online account becomes fully secured.
A strong password is one of the most important precautions you can take in protecting you and your information.
We all know we need to use strong passwords. Every news story about a data breach or stolen identity is a reminder of this need.
